page.title: 18Schools
page.content: {St Mary's College}has 600 pupils. Its head teacher is male. There are 43 groups with 47 teachers. Pupils are aged between 16 and 18+.{Pleckgate {High}has 1217 pupils. Its headteacher is male. There are 76 teachers and the school is 17 years old. The youngest pupils are 11 and the oldest 16. {Lammack County Primary}with 415 children, male headteacher and 15 teachers was built in 1953. There are 15 classes of children from 5 to 11 years.{St Mary's CE, Mellor}has 109 pupils aged from 5 to 11 in 4 classes with 4 teachers including the headmaster. The school started in 1833, the present building built 1883. St Mary's RC has 27 children from 5 to 11 years taught by 2 teachers including a headmistress. The school was built in 1840.
